caption: The new restaurant CDA at Sofitel Chicago Magnificent Mile is amazing! I am so glad I was lucky enough to have tried lunch at this Mediterranean inspired eatery.

Wow, what an phenomenal meal. Came by to try to the restaurant week menu with the three-course wine pairing.  The scallops were perfectly cooked and paired well with the horseradish sauce. The lentils were a bit bland, but added a good balance.  The duck breast was incredibly tender, and the pistachio bits and warm pear slices were a great addition.  The sticky date pudding was not at all what I expected but so delectable. I was blown away with the first bite!  Although the prices seem a bit high outside of RW, I was thoroughly impressed and would definitely consider CDA for a special night out.

This place is an excellent find for CA . It has won awards for being one of the most romantic dinner settings. I thought it had a very cool vibe! It is a bit pricey, but to be expected for location and quality of food. The grilled octopus appetizer is excellent as well.

While the food was quite delicious, it was overshadowed by the poor service and ambience. The ambience feels like a 90s chrome explosion, very harsh and not enjoyable. For the service, we were very disappointed that we ordered several courses to share, and specifically asked for them to be spaced out so we could enjoy each course as it came. All five dishes were delivered within five minutes of each other. It was not an enjoyable experience. Sadly, I do not think we will return.
Good food and service, seating not very private. If your by the window your pretty close to the couple next to you.
The Crispy Haloumi was incredibly good. It is a friend cheese with sheep's milk (I looked it up) and the flavor is mild, nutty, and well paired with the sweet sauce.
Cancelled our reservation two days before the scheduled date. Offered no apology for the inconvenience or late notice.

On the first visit, I went with a friend and we had a round of appetizers for small plates. The l'amuse of trout croquette over aioli was a great start. The lump crab was a big hit, as it was all crab with no filler breading. The heart of palm and the summer squash soup were winners. We finished with escargot pappardelle and butternut squash with shrimp and truffles. All was great paired with champagne, Chardonnay, and Pinot Noir. And we ended with espresso, mango macarons, and key lime wrapped in chocolate.

The new restaurant CDA at Sofitel Chicago Magnificent Mile is amazing! I am so glad I was lucky enough to have tried lunch at this Mediterranean inspired eatery.CDA is open for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner. The variety was interesting and diverse. Since it is set up as mostly small plates, we had the opportunity to try/share many options. Warm bread in various choices was delivered table side. Then we enjoyed Tzatziki, Asparagus Salad, Croquetas, Crab Avocado Toast and the Shrimp Protein Bowl. Everything was expertly prepared and served very attractively. I absolutely loved every bite!

Disappointed, on yelp says French and now it's Mediterranean. Menu is completely different. Shrimp wasn't fresh, the salad too salty, waitress said the baby octopus is good, we tried it but it's bland, and the fish was supposed to be sea bass, she says it's the most popular, it's nothing like any sea bass i had in other restaurants, doesn't taste like it, doesn't look like it. Paella was under cooked, we had to cancel it, cuz we don't want to wait 30-45 mins for it. All the pictures on Yelp for the former French restaurant looks good, that's why me and my friends wanna try it out, but not the actual Mediterranean restaurant now, not recommended.
Breakfast was good and CDA is. very centrally located.

This is a great restaurant with fantastic food.  Try the baby octopus for dinner.  A wonderful combination of flavors. Breakfast is awesome wonderful. The breakfast bowl is a very satisfying dish. Service was a bit spotty and slow on the several occasions I was there but still friendly.

The food was ok. The service though was something SPECIAL. First, the waitress left without getting our full order, then she said that she put in a different order because we spoke a different language!? About 30 min after arriving we asked to go over everything that we've ordered just so we won't have more miscommunications. After we were done with main course, had to wait another 15 min to order dessert. We've got surprised again, waitress left with half order, I only had time to order ice cream for my daughter. As for my wife and I, we didn't get to order any desert, just watched our daughter finish the ice cream, paid the bill and left. I don't recommend this place, restrooms are in hotel's lobby on the second floor. Worse restaurant experience we've ever had. In two and a half hours that we've been there for, we had been asked once how the meal was, finished my water and nobody noticed.  Don't recommend it, I expected more from this place, it feels like an average PUB food and drinks in a high end hotel. Very disappointed!

After a couple of visits a trend emerged: poor service.  This is unfortunate because the food is good.  Unfortunately, at these prices, and in this neighborhood, the service should be much better.  To illustrate: during our last visit we waited ~15 minutes for our bill.  We finally gave up and went to the host stand.  Another miss - if you order the "American Breakfast" you automatically receive coffee and the pastry cart - a good deal (and the pastries looked great).  However, the last time we were there we were never offered pastries.  After reviewing the bill, the charges for the pastry were still present.  We couldn't find our server to ask for them to be removed so we just paid.  Little things like that make a big difference in a city with an ample supply of high quality restaurants.

Found CDA tucked away in the Sofitel amongst the many restaurants off Rush. Very glad to see the rebranded/reconfigured CDA take shape. Liked the "French Bistro" small bites, shared plates portions. The charcuterie selections and cheese are to die for, Jamon Serrano took our lead as well as Bresoala and Sobrasada. We made our own platter and it came served with toast points, jams and honey glazed nuts. we added Manchego over the Camembert. it was way too hot for a spreadable cheese. We decided to make shared plates our meals and can't get enough of the Crispy Haloumi, you'll fight over the crunchy bits. The Baby Octopus was sous vide and grilled to perfection... all this made a geeat meal for two. We can't wait to come back and make it to table portions and dessert.

My girlfriend at the time took me here for my birthday and I'm not kidding when I say it was the best meal I ever had. But for the price, it shouldn't have been anything less. Amazing food, great service and lovely atmosphere. My only complaint is that I got the feeling the waitress was wondering what people like us were doing there.
Excellent French Restaurant in Chicago
Very friendly staff. Food was okay .
My favorite place for breakfast in Chicago.
Still one of the best breakfasts in town!
Amazing
Food and service are great! A lot of food for the money. Open 24 hrs every day.
My favorite place to have breakfast in Chicago. French press coffee and eggs benedict for me and waffle for my husband and we had yummy French pastry.

Coffee here is awesome. Was chatting with the owner (who is super nice btw) and I asked him about the coffee. He said he gets his beans from the only toaster he knows in the area who uses wood for the roasting rather than gas! Wow!  Will definitely be back next time I'm in IL .  Oh - and the lox and cream cheese bagels are great too.
Amazing food!! Amazing service!!!
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Excelente
At Sofitel Hotel in downtown Chicago
Good service but for being inside Sofitel expected much more; portions are "cheap" under the guise of being concerned about guests health. Pleeeeese! Give me at LEAST one full slice of bacon.

Went here for restaurant week. They had some cool options but I was a bit underwhelmed and their bread was hard as a rock. I think their desserts are what they are known for and those were great and creative.  Again - This was for restaurant week and not a regular visit so their options and staffing may look different.

My five star rating is for breakfast only.  This restaurant does something better than any other place in the city. You’ll have to wade through my review to find out what. Trust me. It’s worth the wait.  Breakfast is the only meal I have eaten there. It’s not cheap. With a tip, it’s always $26-$28 for me. It’s my splurge for the week. I go there every week. It’s amazingly consistent. I’ve yet to have anything that wasn’t terrific. I highly recommend the yogurt, granola, compote bowl. The pancakes are out of this world. Well of course it comes with real maple syrup and French butter. I should mention the coffee. It’s a French press and it’s impressive for. $5.00. I’m a bacon and eggs guy. The bacon is always freshly cooked, not dragged off the north-forty of the grill for a quick heating job. The French cooks ( and it is a French kitchen) cooks eggs perfectly. A secret from me to you, let your waiter know you’d like to skip the potatoes and instead have a taste of fruit. This isn’t your ordinary fruit. It’s blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, etc. picked at perfection. Best berries in the city. One of the things I love about this place is food temperature is right on the money. I’m saving the best for last. Shortly after coffee is poured your waiter will come by with a long tray of croissants, chocolate brioche and bread. There is no better bread or pastry. I’ve never, ever, ever had a better croissant in my life. Not even in Paris.
Good French food and excellent service.

Nice bright open space. Expensive. But the complimentary pastry basket at brunch has really good croissants. Wheelchair accessible entrance and service was accommodating for the chair. Food was not memorable.
Ambiance is depressing
Upscale French in modern atmosphere served by fun, attentive, and friendly staff. Best French experience so far!
Very good coffee. Decent food. Quite pricey.
Great option for brunch on weekends!!
Best views in the Gold Coast/magnificent mile
food was delicious, wine was WAY overpriced, service was exceedingly mediocre

I've been here for breakfast a few times. The breakfast is expensive, so I expected a higher-end experience than what we can get at dedicated breakfast places. One server who seemed to be very unhappy about working there (maybe because she'd been highly educated in her country and thought this was below her?) treated us like we were commoners, and when my elderly dad mistakenly took a piece of bread instead of a croissant, she didn't want to give him a croissant instead. She complained to the manager, who allowed him the substitute. The server's attitude was rude, apathetic, and condescending. I've experienced better customer service at McDonald's and many other places, and I'm not facetiously saying that. Bottom line: the service doesn't match the price, and the decor is basically like an eating hall, unless you're lucky enough to sit in the more upscale front area. The food is very good, but going forward, I won't take my chances again. Not worth the price.

One of my favorite french restaurants for brunch in Chicago. Authentic French pastries,  excellent breads and brioche and a comfortable casual setting. The staff is attentive and some are actually French!
Amazing dinner and service here

What a wonderful meal we had here! I loved the combination of Michelin-star level cuisine with friendly, fun service. Romi, the singing waiter provided theatrically French attentiveness without being stiff, and Chef David visited our table multiple times to make sure we enjoyed everything.  Perhaps all this attention was due to our ordering the menu degustation, as none of the other diners seemed to be having it. I can’t imagine why, as it is a real deal. David checked with us beforehand to make sure it was okay for him to serve different members of our party different dishes in each course, and we enthusiastically agreed, as it allowed us to sample twice as many dishes.  And dishes galore there were, each artfully arranged, and accompanied by thoughtful wine pairings. I’ll let the photos speak for themselves, but suffice it to say that each was just as delicious as it looks.  The pastry chef continued the trend with four spectacular desserts, some of which she concocted on the spot.  We will be back soon, as the creativity here seems endless.
Butternut squash tortellini had the most amazingly savory brown butter sauce.

Food: 3 Decor: 4 Service: 2  Came here with the gf and her parents for lunch around 1pm Saturday. 3-hour non-dinner valet parking is $13 with restaurant validation.  Bread basket was good - chocolate croissant, small baguettes, and some other items.  1. Brunch sampler, 25 Served with fresh fruit juice and coffee or tea ~Good. Opted for oj.  Trio of exotic fruit kebabs *** ~Good. Instead of pieces of fruit on a stick, the kebabs were actually three tall shot glasses of fruit juice. Last time I checked the dictionary, a kebab is "a dish consisting of small pieces of meat, tomatoes, onions, etc, threaded onto skewers and grilled, generally over charcoal."  pastrami smoked salmon with caviar crème fraîche mesclun greens chicken and waffle mini white truffle omelet *** ~Okay. Smoked salmon was okay, but the bread and onions didn't pair well. Mesclun green salad was pretty good, and whatever ingredient looked like dirt underneath the salad was amusing and creative. Chicken and waffle was mediocre, as was the omelet.  assorted mini desserts ~Mediocre. We got honey vanilla parfait, a chocolate layered cake, and a strawberry panna cotta with nuts and strawberries. Honey vanilla parfait was too sweet, and I didn't like the pairing on top. Cake was okay, and the panna cotta was more like a marshmallow.  Service was disappointing. They gave my gf oj instead of the grapefruit juice she ordered. I brought it up to a male server, but they still didn't fix the problem. I then brought it up with our original server, who was nowhere to be seen until the end of our meal, and it was eventually fixed.
Awesome formal European restaurant inside the Sofitel.  Expensive, but worth it.

Fantastic brunch option. Quaint and peaceful environment even on a Sunday. The pastries were great and the breakfast options were really good. We didn't realize they were closing and stayed an hour past their normal hours. The staff never requested for us to leave and they were extremely professional.
Not an average hotel restaurant - it's an excellent restaurant that shares a building with a hotel.

Enjoyed a magnificent Valentine's Day dinner with my beautiful girlfriend, Lina. Very good food, real French waiter. Expensive and French. Most expensive dinner we've ever had, and it was well worth the investment. 👍

"Best meal,  experience and server in a long time.  Delicious food,  beautiful presentation, elegant but unpretentious.  Very pleasant and engaging server (he sings too!)" P.s. The chicken ballentine and warm chocolate bread pudding were fabulous.

We love this restaurant. The ambiance, the food, the presentation, the service.  We've been here twice.  Once for dinner and once for New Year's Eve.  I prefer ordering from their menu over their price fixe menu.  While the presentation was on par both times, the food was not as good on New Year's eve (price fixe menu) as it was when we ordered from their dinner menu.  Service was excellent both times.  Definitely will return.

Came here for lunch during the week. Many of business luncheon are happening. Service is pretty good.  Their 4 course lunch menu was not impressive as all four of mini dishes came at once on a big plate. Taste was not bad,,,,but I will not get it again if I go back. Their chicken sandwich was pretty good. The restaurant is located on the first floor left side of sofitel entrance. It is pretty small place.  Taste: 3-4 rating Service: 4 rating Atmosphere: 2. i found dirty spot on the couch. restaurant is pretty small..
Been there for the brunch. Their pastry is great and love the freshly squeezed juice
I have a five years addiction to the Cafe. Love the brunch
Superb. Creative.
Very good french cuisine. excellent food for the prices. Had a three course meal for $40!! Desserts are amazing! try the hazelnut chocolate< you will not be disappointed
Great food...almost like France.

Located in the Sofitel, the location is convenient and beautiful. I went there with a couple of friends to experience the prefix menu, which the restaurant had discontinued (30 under $30). I ended up ordering the braised beef short rib, it was dry and tasteless. Not recommended for the price I paid.
Great croissants.  Heavenly waffles and French toast.  Freshly made orange juice.  Coffee could be better though.  It's delightful to start the day there.
The chef always has some unique dishes and they are always great.
Starting with a solid culinary foundation, this is fine dining prepared and presented flawlessly.
for lunch on a weekday for brunch is weekends in a great choice.  everything esquisitely prepared, good service.
